content.text: At the instant just after the switches are thrown in the circuits of <image 1>, find v in (c) figure.

At the instant just after the switches are thrown, the current through the 5Ω inductor will be 5A to the right and the current through the 3Ω inductor will be 0. Therefore, the current through the 20Ω resistor will be 5 + 0 = 5A to the right. By Ohm's law, the voltage across the 20Ω resistor will be 5 * 20 = 100V to the right.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
